section.title: Overview
section.para: This article describes how to use Groovy scripts as REST services. We are going to consider these operations:

listitem.para: Load script and save it in JCR.
Deploy newly created Class as RESTful service.
And finally we will discover simple example which can get JCR node UUID

section.para: In this article, we consider RESTful service compatible with JSR-311 specification. Currently last feature available in version 1.11-SNAPSHOT of JCR, 2.0-SNAPSHOT of WS and version 2.1.4-SNAPSHOT of core.

section.title: Loading script and save it in JCR
section.para: There are two ways to save a script in JCR. The first way is to save it at server startup time by using configuration.xml and the second way is to upload the script via HTTP.
This way can be used for load prepared scripts, to use this way. we must configure org.exoplatform.services.jcr.ext.script.groovy.GroovyScript2RestLoaderPlugin. This is simple configuration example.

The first is value-param sets JCR repository, the second is value-param sets workspace and the third one is sets JCR node where scripts from plugin will be stored. If specified node does not exist, then it will be created. List of scripts is set by properties-params. Name of each properties-param will be used as node name for stored script, property autoload says to deploy this script at startup time, property path sets the source of script to be loaded. In this example we try to load single script from local file /home/andrew/JcrGroovyTest.groovy.
This is samples of HTTP requests. In this example, we will upload script from file with name test.groovy.
This example imitate sending data with HTML form ('multipart/form-data'). Parameter autoload is optional. If parameter autoload=true then script will be instantiate and deploy script immediately.

section.title: Deploying newly created Class as RESTful service
section.para: To deploy script automatically at server statup time, its property exo:autoload must be set as true. org.exoplatform.services.jcr.ext.script.groovy.GroovyScript2RestLoader check JCR workspaces which were specified in configuration and deploy all auto-loadable scripts.

section.para: Now we are going to try simple example of Groovy RESTfull service. section.title: Groovy script restrictions
section.para: You should keep one class per one groovy file. The same actually for interface and it implementation. It's limitation of groovy parser that does not have type Class[] parseClass(InputStream) or Collection parseClass(InputStream) but only Class parseClass(InputStream) instead.
That is all.
